input.name: __VIEWSTATE

div.span: Asheboro City Schools Responds to COVID-19

span.div: ACS is continuing to work with public health officials to monitor the ongoing novel coronavirus (COVID-19) situation. At this time, all public schools are closed to students by Executive Order from Governor Roy Cooper for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. Below is a link to our Coronavirus (COVID-19) Resources webpage. We will update this information everyday by 7 p.m.

a.span: Remote Learning and Extended Learning Page

li.a: Remote Learning and Extended Learning Options

div.div:
Home \
Support Services \
Coronavirus (COVID-19): Updates and Resources

input.name: ucLeftNav$ctl00$hfParentId

li.a: Remote Learning and Extended Learning Options
Board Policies and Calendars Under Review
Asheboro City Schools Safety Tip Line

p.style: background-color: transparent; color: #000000; font-family: "Times New Roman"; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.08px

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 14.66px; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.style: background-color: transparent; color: #000000; font-family: "Times New Roman"; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.08px

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 14.66px; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Today is Tuesday, April 28 and we are now in our seventh week of remote learning. As most of you know, this is how we will continue to engage with our students for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year as declared by Governor Cooper last Friday.

p.style: background-color: transparent; color: #000000; font-family: "Times New Roman"; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.08px

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 14.66px; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: In addition to continued remote learning, we will also continue serving meals on Tuesday and Friday via mobile meal delivery and food distribution sites at each ACS school. Please note, we are supplying meals for three days in each bag for children ages 0-18. We want to reiterate that families should only be getting one bag per child.

p.style: background-color: transparent; color: #000000; font-family: "Times New Roman"; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.08px

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 14.66px; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: There have been many questions about the Class of 2020 graduation. We want our families to know that we are committed to having a commencement ceremony for this year’s seniors. The Asheboro High School administrative team is developing plans now. Given social distancing guidelines and stay-at-home executive orders however, commencement may take place in August rather than June. More details are forthcoming.

p.style: background-color: transparent; color: #000000; font-family: "Times New Roman"; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.08px

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 14.66px; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: As I mentioned on Friday, the State Board of Education has passed a new grading policy for districts in North Carolina.

span.style: color: #222222; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 14.66px; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Our instructional team will be working through the details of this new policy with our administrators and teachers this week. Once we have definitive plans, we will share these details.

p.style: background-color: transparent; color: #000000; font-family: "Times New Roman"; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.08px

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 14.66px; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: In conclusion, I’m pleased to share we have added two new Park and Learn locations in Asheboro for students and families without high-speed home internet access. In addition to our schools, Park and Learns are now accessible at the George Washington Carver Community Enrichment Center and at Our Daily Bread Soup Kitchen.

p.style: background-color: transparent; color: #000000; font-family: "Times New Roman"; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.08px

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 14.66px; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: We appreciate your continued support. Please feel free to contact us on the ACS Coronavirus Hotline at (336) 542-1007 if you need any assistance.

p.style: background-color: transparent; color: #000000; font-family: "Times New Roman"; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.08px

div.span:
1126 South Park StreetAsheboro, NC 27203
P: 336.625.5104 | F: 336.625.9238

span.div: Asheboro City Schools was established in 1905. Located in the heart of North Carolina, Asheboro City Schools serves approximately 4,500 students at eight schools and one five-star, nationally-accredited Early Childhood Development Center. The district is accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools (SACS CASI).

div.span: does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, disability or age in its programs and activities and provides equal access to the Boy Scouts and other designated youth groups. The Title IX Coordinator has been designated to handle inquiries regarding the non-discrimination policies. 1126 South Park Street Asheboro, NC 27203 336-625-5104.
© 2020 Asheboro City Schools. All Rights Reserved.
